page.title: 17SHELTON HALL
page.content: The 17th century house was built on the site of a 15th century hall & is surrounded by 60 acres of wooded parkland,where sheep graze.The farmland was recently sold.Nearby is the Great Barn,a large 3 bay early 17th century building built of red brick from the old manor & in good condition providing storage.The Courthouse,a 16th century timber framed building, now needs repair. These are all listed Grade 2.A deep brick walled moat surrounds the house with water in most parts.The site of the original house was the Dark Park,a field distant, marked by a strip of moat & trees in parkland. Elizabeth 1, as an infant was hidden after her mother's execution by her great aunt Lady Shelton at the Hall.
